titles.title: State Water Sovereignty Protection Act
A bill to preserve the authority of States over water within their boundaries, to delegate to States the authority of Congress to regulate water, and for other purposes.
State Water Sovereignty Protection Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: State Water Sovereignty Protection Act - Directs the United States, when it seeks to appropriate water or acquire a water right in a State, to be subject to all procedural and substantive laws of that State relating to its water rights and uses. Gives consent to join the United States in any State proceeding relating to the allocation or use of a water right.Subjects management and control of water in a State to the laws of such State. Delegates to each State the authority to regulate water. Allows the United States to exercise management and control of water in a State only in compliance with that State's laws.Subjects the United States to the imposition of costs and fees in a proceeding to the same extent as a private person.
